intro: Gagea minima f. rufula, commonly known as the rufula form of the small gagea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Liliaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant is native to regions of North America, particularly in the western United States and parts of Canada. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
